<br> <br> 
I am a research specialist in the lab of H. Benjamin Larman at Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine in the Department of Pathology. My job gives me the opportunity to develop high-throughput, massively-multiplexed immune profiling assays and to design bioinformatics software for related data analyses.

I graduated from the University of California, Berkeley with a BS in bioengineering in 2015. Before joining the Larman Lab, I worked as an ORISE research fellow at the Food and Drug Administration.
